description: Connect your app with shopping carts. As many as you need. Via one integration.
steps: Go to https://app.api2cart.com/stores to get your apiKey

args.name: cartId
args.info: Store’s identifier which you can get from cart_list method

args.name: storeUrl
args.info: A web address of a store that you would like to connect to API2Cart

args.name: bridgeUrl
args.info: This parameter allows to set up store with custom bridge url

args.name: storeRoot
args.info: Absolute path to the store root directory

args.name: storeKey
args.info: Set this parameter if bridge is already uploaded to store

args.name: validateVersion
args.info: Specify if api2cart should validate cart version

args.name: adminAccount
args.info: It's a BigCommerce account for which API is enabled

args.name: clientId
args.info: Client ID of the requesting app.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token authorizing the app to access resources on behalf of a user

args.name: login
args.info: It's a Volusion account for which API is enabled

args.name: apiUser
args.info: It's a AspDotNetStorefront account for which API is available

args.name: apiSecretKey
args.info: Shopping Cart Elite API Secret Key

args.name: tokenSecret
args.info: Secret token authorizing the app to access resources on behalf of a user

args.name: ebayRuname
args.info: The RuName value that eBay assigns to your application.

args.name: ebayRefreshToken
args.info: Used to renew the access token.

blocks.name: validateCart
blocks.description: Check store availability, bridge connection for the downloadable carts etc

args.name: validateVersion
args.info: Specify if api2cart should validate cart version

blocks.name: getCartBridge
blocks.description: Get bridge key and store key

blocks.name: disconnectCart
blocks.description: Disconnect with the store and clear store session data.

args.name: deleteBridge
args.info: Identifies if there is a necessity to delete bridge

args.name: params
args.info: Set this parameter in order to choose which entity fields you want to retrieve

args.name: exclude
args.info: Set this parameter in order to choose which entity fields you want to ignore. Works only if parameter `params` equal force_all

args.info: Set this parameter in order to choose which entity fields you want to retrieve

args.info: This parameter sets the list of params to the shopping cart.

args.info: This parameter sets the number from which you want to get entities

args.name: count
args.info: This parameter sets the entity amount that has to be retrieved

args.info: Filter entity by date_start (greater or equal)

args.name: dateStartTo

args.name: amount
args.info: Defines the gift card amount value.

args.name: actionApplyTo
args.info: Defines where discount should be applied

args.name: actionScope
args.info: Specify how discount should be applied.

args.name: dateStart
args.info: Defines when discount code will be available.

args.name: dateEnd
args.info: Defines when discount code will be expired.

args.name: actionConditionKey
args.info: Defines entity attribute code for action condition.

args.name: actionConditionValues
args.info: Defines condition attribute value/s. Can be comma separated string.

args.name: cacheType
args.info: Defines which cache should be cleared.

args.name: name
args.info: Defines product's name that has to be added

args.name: model

args.info: Defines the date of special price expiration

args.name: availableForView
args.info: Specifies the set of visible/invisible products for users

args.name: availableForSale
args.info: Specifies the set of visible/invisible products for sale

args.name: downloadable
args.info: Defines whether the product is downloadable

args.name: viewedCount
args.info: Specifies the number of product's reviews

args.name: orderedCount
args.info: Specifies the number of product's orders

args.name: attributeSetName
args.info: Defines product’s attribute set name in Magento

args.name: attributeName
args.info: Defines product’s attribute name in Magento

args.name: shippingTemplateId
args.info: The numeric ID of the shipping template associated with the products in Etsy.

args.name: condition
args.info: The human-readable label for the condition (e.g., "New").

args.name: listingDuration
args.info: Describes the number of days the seller wants the listing to be active.

args.name: paymentMethods
args.info: Identifies the payment method (such as PayPal) that the seller will accept when the buyer pays for the item.

args.name: returnAccepted
args.info: Indicates whether the seller allows the buyer to return the item.

args.name: shippingDetails
args.info: The numeric ID of the shipping template associated with the products in Etsy.

args.name: paypalEmail
args.info: Valid PayPal email address for the PayPal account that the seller will use if they offer PayPal as a payment method for the listing.

blocks.name: addWebhook
blocks.description: Create webhook on the store and subscribe to it

args.name: entity
args.info: Specify the entity that you want to enable webhooks for (e.g product, order, customer, category)

args.name: action
args.info: Specify what action (event) will trigger the webhook (e.g add, delete, or update)

args.name: callback
args.info: Callback where the webhook should send the POST request when the event occurs

args.name: label
args.info: The name you give to the webhook

args.name: active
args.info: The webhook status you want to filter webhooks by
